intro: Microlonchus, commonly known as the narrowleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, twining stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. Microlonchus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine in some cultures.
